commands.name: az network dns record-set mx add-record
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx add-record --exchange
                                        --preference
                                        --record-set-name
                                        --resource-group
                                        --zone-name
                                        [--if-none-match]
                                        [--ttl]
examples:
az network dns record-set mx add-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -e mail.mysite.com -p 10

commands.name: az network dns record-set mx create
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx create --name
                                    --resource-group
                                    --zone-name
                                    [--if-match]
                                    [--if-none-match]
                                    [--metadata]
                                    [--target-resource]
                                    [--tm-profile]
                                    [--ttl]
examples: az network dns record-set mx create -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet --metadata owner=WebTeam

commands.name: az network dns record-set mx delete
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx delete [--ids]
                                    [--if-match]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--subscription]
                                    [--yes]
                                    [--zone-name]
examples: az network dns record-set mx delete -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network dns record-set mx list
commands.summary: List MX record sets in a zone.
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx list --resource-group
                                  --zone-name
                                  [--max-items]
                                  [--next-token]
                                  [--recordsetnamesuffix]
                                  [--top]
examples: az network dns record-set mx list -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com

commands.name: az network dns record-set mx remove-record
commands.summary: Remove an MX record from its record set.
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx remove-record --exchange
                                           --preference
                                           --record-set-name
                                           --resource-group
                                           --zone-name
                                           [--keep-empty-record-set]
examples:
az network dns record-set mx remove-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -e mail.mysite.com -p 10

commands.name: az network dns record-set mx show
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx show [--ids]
                                  [--name]
                                  [--resource-group]
                                  [--subscription]
                                  [--zone-name]
examples: az network dns record-set mx show -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network dns record-set mx update
commands.syntax:
az network dns record-set mx update [--add]
                                    [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--ids]
                                    [--if-match]
                                    [--if-none-match]
                                    [--metadata]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--remove]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--set]
                                    [--subscription]
                                    [--target-resource]
                                    [--tm-profile]
                                    [--zone-name]
examples: az network dns record-set mx update -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet --metadata owner=WebTeam
